alert.note: Alert for Cass; Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 10 at 8:07PM CST until March 10 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Forks has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Clay County in northwestern Minnesota... Eastern Norman County in northwestern Minnesota... Southeastern Polk County in northwestern Minnesota... Northwestern Otter Tail County in west central Minnesota... Wilkin County in west central Minnesota... Mahnomen County in northwestern Minnesota... Becker County in northwestern Minnesota... Southern Clearwater County in northwestern Minnesota... Southeastern Cass County in southeastern North Dakota... Northern Richland County in southeastern North Dakota... * Until 900 PM CST. * At 806 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Mentor to near Twin Valley to Averill to 7 miles west of Colfax, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 29 and 59. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 1 and 58. This snow squall will be near... Twin Valley, Mentor and Gary around 810 PM CST. Erskine and Waukon around 815 PM CST. Faith, Muskoda and Flom around 820 PM CST. McIntosh, Galchutt and Hawley around 825 PM CST. McCauleyville, Abercrombie and Hitterdal around 830 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this snow squall include Moorhead Airport and Fergus Falls Airport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
